Body:
We were given some data and the questions below. I don't need someone to tell me the answer, I just need someone to help explain what X after X construction is. It makes NO sense to me!

Major questions: what is the structure of the construction itself? What type of phrase is it, whatâ€™s its head? Jackendoff presents one analysis where the first N is the head, and the rest is its complement. He ultimately favors an analysis where this is a strange sort of PP, though, with the P as its head. You should present possible trees of each of these types and choose one.
Title: X after X construction?

LastEditedUser.AboutMe:
Travelling armchair linguist.

Never studied in an institution but read books and web with probably more breadth than depth.

Always on the road surviving in a strange foreign language, currently Mongolian and Mandarin Chinese.

And I collect dictionaries.
